availableClusterVersions.Description: The available cluster code version which the cluster can upgrade to, note that you must choose upgradeMode to manual to upgrade to

clusterId.Description: The unique identifier for the cluster resource

clusterEndpoint.Description: The endpoint for the cluster connecting to servicefabric resource provider

clusterCodeVersion.Description: The ServiceFabric code version running in your cluster

certificate.Description: This primary certificate will be used as cluster node to node security, SSL certificate for cluster management endpoint and default admin client

reliabilityLevel.Description: Cluster reliability level indicates replica set size of system service

upgradeMode.Description: Cluster upgrade mode indicates if fabric upgrade is initiated automatically by the system or not

clientCertificateThumbprints.Description: The client thumbprint details ,it is used for client access for cluster operation

clientCertificateCommonNames.Description: List of client certificates to trust based on common names

fabricSettings.Description: List of custom fabric settings to configure the cluster.

reverseProxyCertificate.Description: The server certificate used by reverse proxy

managementEndpoint.Description: The http management endpoint of the cluster

nodeTypes.Description: The list of node types that make up the cluster

azureActiveDirectory.Description: The settings to enable AAD authentication on the cluster

provisioningState.Description: The provisioning state of the cluster resource

vmImage.Description: The name of VM image VMSS has been configured with. Generic names such as Windows or Linux can be used.

diagnosticsStorageAccountConfig.Description: The storage diagnostics account configuration details

upgradeDescription.Description: The policy to use when upgrading the cluster.

codeVersion.Description: The ServiceFabric runtime version of the cluster

supportExpiryUtc.Description: The date of expiry of support of the version

isAdmin.Description: Is this certificate used for admin access from the client, if false, it is used or query only access
Is this certificate used for admin access from the client, if false , it is used or query only access

certificateCommonName.Description: Certificate common name to be granted access; be careful using wild card common names

parameters.Description: Collection of settings in the section, each setting is a tuple consisting of setting name and value

placementProperties.Description: The placement tags applied to nodes in the node type, which can be used to indicate where certain services (workload) should run

capacities.Description: The capacity tags applied to the nodes in the node type, the cluster resource manager uses these tags to understand how much of a resource a node has

clientConnectionEndpointPort.Description: The TCP cluster management endpoint port

httpGatewayEndpointPort.Description: The HTTP cluster management endpoint port

isPrimary.Description: Mark this as the primary node type

vmInstanceCount.Description: The number of node instances in the node type

startPort.Description: Starting port of a range of ports

endPort.Description: End port of a range of ports

clusterApplication.Description: Azure active directory cluster application id

clientApplication.Description: Azure active directory client application id

overrideUserUpgradePolicy.Description: Use the user defined upgrade policy or not

forceRestart.Description: Force node to restart or not

upgradeReplicaSetCheckTimeout.Description: Timeout for replica set upgrade to complete,it represents .Net TimeSpan

healthCheckWaitDuration.Description: The length of time to wait after completing an upgrade domain before performing health checks, it represents .Net TimeSpan

healthCheckStableDuration.Description: The length of time that health checks must pass continuously,it represents .Net TimeSpan

healthCheckRetryTimeout.Description: The length of time that health checks can fail continuously,it represents .Net TimeSpan

upgradeDomainTimeout.Description: The timeout for any upgrade domain,it represents .Net TimeSpan

maxPercentUnhealthyNodes.Description: The maximum allowed percentage of unhealthy nodes before reporting an error. For example, to allow 10% of nodes to be unhealthy, this value would be 10.

maxPercentUnhealthyApplications.Description: The maximum allowed percentage of unhealthy applications before reporting an error. For example, to allow 10% of applications to be unhealthy, this value would be 10.

maxPercentUpgradeDomainDeltaUnhealthyNod.Description: Additional unhealthy nodes percentage per upgrade domain
